IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Napa Valley Festival Association is committed to enriching the cultural vitality of the community and making the arts accessible to all. The Association supports arts education initiatives and presents the annual Festival Napa Valley.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Napa Valley Festival Association is committed to enriching the cultural vitality of the community and making the arts accessible to all. The Association supports arts education initiatives and presents the annual Festival Napa Valley, a 10-day summer celebration pairing world-class performances with culinary and wine pursuits staged in iconic wine country settings.
IRS990.Desc: Napa Valley Festival Association presents the annual Festival Napa Valley, a ten-day summer celebration that enriches the cultural and economic vitality of the region. Blending the beauty and bounty of Napa Valley with the very finest performing arts, the festival pairs world-class performances with culinary and wine pursuits staged in iconic wine country settings. More than 200 artists, wineries, resorts, theaters, restaurants and vintners participate each year. Programs include classical music, jazz, opera, theater and dance, food and wine events, wellness programs, free community concerts, and a young artist series providing performance opportunities and scholarship support for emerging talent. One in every four seats is provided free of charge to veterans, seniors, youth and low-income families. The organization supports numerous arts education initiatives in schools and community organizations year-round.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The organization awards grants to local schools and non-profit arts organizations to support K-12 visual and performing arts programs. Festival artists offer free workshops, master classes and performances to local students, artists, teachers and community organizations. In addition, one in every four Festival Napa Valley seats is provided free of charge to veterans, seniors, youth and low-income families.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Substantially all grants are made to public charities in California. A letter accompanies the issuance of the grant funds. When applicable, organization staff contacts grantees to obtain summary reports regarding the use of the funds.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTOR MARIA SHUSTOROVICH IS THE MOTHER OF THE MAJORITY OWNER OF IMG ARTISTS LLC. IMG assisted the organization in the production of its Festival Napa Valley under a contract that was subject to the initial contract exception of regulation section 53.4958-4(a)(3). Ms. Shustorovich became a director after the contract was executed. Ms. Shustorovich resigned her director position on October 1, 2015, and the contract was terminated on December 5, 2015.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ATHENA AND TIMOTHY BLACKBURN ARE MARRIED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared by a public accounting firm. The Executive Committee conducts a review of the organization's Form 990 (including all related Schedules). Any questions, comments, and suggested revisions identified by the Executive Committee are addressed and the preparer of the Form 990 makes any necessary revisions. The form is then filed with the internal revenue service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Paid staff and board members are required to annually document in writing any interests, relationships or holdings that could potentially result in a conflict of interest. If a conflict of interest is identified from an annual disclosure, the organization's executive committee will review the conflict and take appropriate action, which may include prohibiting an individual from participating in the board's deliberations and decisions regarding a certain transaction. If a conflict is identified during a meeting, the entire Board will decide what appropriate action to take.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's executive committee has general oversight of the organization's human resource plan, including annual evaluation of the executive director of the organization. A salary survey is used to benchmark compensation for the executive director position. The committee meets independent of the executive director to discuss performance relative to the position description. During these meetings, the committee also considers input obtained from other board members, staff, professional advisors, grant recipients, and other informed community leaders. Once a consensus is reached regarding performance, a similar discussion is held concerning compensation relative to annual benchmark and established objectives. The committee then meets with the executive director to discuss and document strengths, weaknesses, and goals for the upcoming year. Compensation for the upcoming year is also discussed and documented.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BYLAWS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AT THE ORGANIZATION'S PRINCIPAL PLACE OF BUSINESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation review and approval procedures for other officers or key employees are not applicable. No other officers of the organization are compensated and the organization has no key employees.
